title: Third Crorepati Of KBC 11, Gautam Kumar Jha Wants To Build A Home In Patna With His Prize Money
text:
Kaun Banega Crorepati was launched on Indian Television when there was a bleeding competition among other talent hunt reality shows. Who would have thought that the show will survive? But after mini hurdles, it did. So much so, that now huge audiences, mostly families, sit together and take the guessing game as questions are asked to contestants on the show.

Twitter

KBC has changed the lives of many people who didn’t quite lead a good life because of financial problems. But after they won humongous amount of money using their intelligence, their lives changed.

Twitter

In this season of KBC, two people have won one crore rupees already. The third one to join the bandwagon is West Bengal’s Gautam Kumar Jha, a senior section engineer in Indian Railways.

Twitter

Don't Miss 5.5 K SHARES 41.5 K SHARES 17.1 K SHARES 2.4 K SHARES 28 K SHARES

The 15th question for Rs 1 crore was “Aboard which made-in-India ship did Francis Scott Key write the poem 'Defence of Fort M'Henry' that became the US national anthem?" Gautam Kumar Jha rightfully answered ‘HMS Minden’. And so, he made history for himself.

Twitter

The next question which was for Rs 7 crore was “What was the name of all the three soccer clubs set up with the help of Mahatma Gandhi in the early 20th century at Durban, Pretoria and Johannesburg?” The options given to Gautam Kumar Jha were – Truth Seekers, Non – Violents, Passive Resisters, Non co-operators. Gautam didn’t know the answer to this unfortunately.

Gautam told Indian Express in an interview, that it was his childhood dream to be on Kaun Banega Crorepati, and now is on cloud nine to have won such a huge amount. When asked what he plans to do with the money he has won, he said, he wants to build a home in Patna and also wants to support girls from his village.

Congratulations, Gautam Kumar Jha!
